{{about |the managerial practice of leaving office door open|the economic policy in China|Open Door Policy}} An '''open door policy''' (as related to the [[business]] and [[corporate]] fields) is a communication policy in which a [[manager]], [[CEO]], MD, president or supervisor leaves their [[office]] door "open" in order to encourage openness and transparency with the employees of that company. As the term implies, employees are encouraged to stop by whenever they feel the need to meet and ask questions, discuss suggestions, and address problems or concerns with management. An open door policy is typically intended to foster an environment of [[collaboration]], high performance, and mutual respect between upper management and employees.
{{quote|An open door policy means, literally, that every manager's door is open to every employee. The purpose of an open door policy is to encourage open communication, feedback, and discussion about any matter of importance to an employee.<ref> [https://www.thebalance.com/open-door-policy-1918203 What Does an Open Door Policy at Work Mean?] - The Balance</ref>}}
== Benefits == Open door policies exist to encourage employees to offer suggestions and ideas, provide or solicit feedback, seek personal or professional counsel, or address concerns within the company. The policy establishes an environment of trust and mutual respect between the employer and employee. The practice is viewed as a [[morale]] booster by letting employees feel as if they are able to openly speak with their employer about issues face-to-face, rather than through [[e-mail]] or [[voicemail]]. In essence, an open door policy serves to empower employees, knowing that their voice is heard and issues are quickly addressed and resolved.<ref name=hp>{{cite web|url=http://www.hp.com/hpinfo/abouthp/diversity/open-door.html |title=HP Diversity: Open Door Policy |publisher=Hp.com |date= |accessdate=2012-01-28}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.baltimoresun.com/2011-11-30/business/bs-twp-infotek-corp-20111204_1_employee-benefits-open-door-policy-infotek |title=Baltimore's Top Workplaces: InfoTeK Corp.: Open-door policy - Baltimore Sun |publisher=Articles.baltimoresun.com |date=2011-11-30 |accessdate=2012-01-28}}</ref> Trust in the company tends to improve and grow, when employees understand that they are welcome to confide in senior management, when immediate supervisors are unavailable.<ref name=sba>{{cite web|url=http://smallbusiness.chron.com/open-door-policy-business-143.html |title=Open Door Policy in Business | Small Business - Chron.com |publisher=Smallbusiness.chron.com |date= |accessdate=2012-01-28}}</ref>
== Disadvantages == While open door policies intend to encourage and instill a sense of transparency and openness, some employees hesitate to speak their mind or be honest, for fear of intimidation, criticism, and censure. Management personnel may tend to communicate the willingness to hear suggestions, while belittling the suggestions when unaccompanied by solutions.
Open door policies have also been seen as a way for companies to discourage the formation of [[labor unions]]. Formal, written policies may encourage openness, however, the response received in attempts to engage are often seen as threats to the authority or management style of the individual working in a supervisory or management capacity.<ref name=cbs>{{cite web|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-505125_162-44440188/is-your-open-door-policy-silencing-your-staff/ |title=Is Your 'Open Door' Policy Silencing Your Staff? |publisher=CBS News |date=2010-04-20 |accessdate=2012-01-28}}</ref> The policy, in essence, allows employees to forgo meeting with their immediate supervisors, choosing rather to engage in communication with their senior managers to discuss their employment or personal issues.
A process of open communication and transparency allows employees to bypass their supervisors to engage with senior management. This may inadvertently lead to tension and strife between employees and middle management. Supervisors may either see this as an implication that they are the primary issue of concern, or they may feel threatened, suspecting the employee of undermining him in an attempt to cause problems between him and senior management.<ref name=sba/>
== Other uses == In other examples, commonly in college dorms,{{citation needed|date=November 2018}} an open door policy means everyone's door must remain open. The idea remains the same, that having the door(s) open will make for a more comfortable and social school or work environment.
Government officials at the local, state, and federal level often implement an open door policy for the purpose of meeting with constituents. In Salt Lake City, mayor [[Ralph Becker (mayor)|Ralph Becker]] maintains an open door policy every Wednesday to meet with residents one-on-one to discuss issues, concerns, and suggestions involving the city.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cityweekly.net/utah/event-108072-open-door-meetings-w.html |title=Open Door Meetings with Mayor Ralph Becker at City & County Building |publisher=Cityweekly.net |date= |accessdate=2012-01-28}}</ref> The Democratic Caucus of Orange County, New York has maintained an open door policy for over ten years, where all individuals, regardless of political affiliation are welcome to attend the meeting.<ref>http://www.recordonline.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20120121/OPINION/201210303/-1/SITEMAP</ref> In 2011, in an effort to introduce a more open and transparent government, Governor [[Andrew Cuomo]] of New York extended an open door policy to members of the public. A lottery was introduced that allowed for 300 New Yorkers to visit [[Gracie Mansion]] following the inaugural festivities. The following week, for the first time in the history of the State of New York, a lottery was held to open the State of the State Address to additional members of the public.<ref>{{cite web|author=  |url=http://www.ny1.com/content/news_beats/politics/131531/cuomo-extends-open-door-policy-to-governor-s-mansion/ |title=Cuomo Extends Open Door Policy To Governor's Mansion |publisher=NY1.com |date=2010-03-30 |accessdate=2012-01-28}}</ref>

{{Use dmy dates|date=November 2015}} {{infobox person |name = Patricia Quintana | children =Patricio y Francisco |image = Chef_Patricia_Quintana.jpg |birth_name = Patricia Quintana Fernández | birth_date = {{birth date|1946|10|28|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Mexico]] | death_date = {{death date and age|2018|11|26|1946|10|28|df=y}} | death_place = Mexico | nationality = Mexican | occupation = [[chef]], writer, businesswoman, professor }} '''Patricia Quintana Fernández''' (28 October 1946 – 26 November 2018)<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/11/23/obituaries/wolfgang-zuckermann-dead.html |title=Patricia Quintana, Champion of Mexican Cuisine, Dies at 72 |first=Tejal |last=Rao |date=November 29, 2018 |work= | website = nytimes.com |accessdate=November 30, 2018|archive-url= http://archive.fo/esbey |archive-date= 2018-11-30 |dead-url=no}}</ref>, was a Mexican [[chef]], writer, businesswoman and professor. She was a recognized international cook and expert in Mexican gastronomy.
== Biography == Patricia Quintana was a specialist in Mexican regional cooking who was born in México and studied abroad in Canada, Switzerland and France — later returning to Mexico as a recognized chef. She studied and taught ancestral [[Mexican cuisine]] mixed with the classical cuisine. She was the owner of the restaurant Izote in [[Mexico City|City of Mexico]] from 2001 to the 2013, but resigned to start a banquet catering company.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.starchefs.com/chefs/PQuintana/html/bio.shtml|title = Patricia Quintana Biografía|author = Start Chefs|location = United States|date = |access-date = 28 July 2013}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.eluniversal.com.mx/articulos/76558.html|title = El Izote renace|author = El Universal|location = México|date = 28 February 2013|access-date = 28 July 2013}}</ref>
She was the creator of the brand of dressings "Gavilla", a brand under which today has about 16 products. She directed the menus that were served aboard Mexican airlines.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.madridfusion.net/chefs_largo.php?id=0000000095|title = Una cocinera mexicana en busca del tiempo perdido|author = Madrid Fusión|location = Spain|date = |access-date = 28 July 2013}}{{dead link|date=March 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
She collaborated in many television programs and wrote articles about cuisine for several newspapers and magazines, both domestic and international.
She was the mother of Patricio Pasquel.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.soyentrepreneur.com/21998-liderazgo-con-sello-propio.html|title = Patricia Quintana: Liderazgo con sello propio|author = soyentrepreneur|location = México|date = 28 August 2012|access-date = 28 July 2013}}</ref>
Patricia passed away at the age of 72, on Nov 26 2018 of natural causes.
== Prizes and honours == She was culinary ambassador of her country for the world, distinction that awarded her the Office of Tourism and the Association of Restaurants of Mexico.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.eluniversal.com.mx/articulos/78137.html|title = Los poderosos de México|author = El Universal|location = México|date = 4 June 2013|access-date = 28 July 2013}}</ref>
She received the Silver Spoon Prize awarded by the magazine "Food Arts"; the Prize of the Gold Laurel by part of the Association Mexico Spain, and the Prize to Employer Restaurantero of the Year, delivered by the CANIRAC in Mexico.

'''Peter Souter''' (born 1962) is the chairman and chief creative officer of [[TBWA]] London<ref>http://tbwa-london.com/about/people/</ref> <ref>https://www.campaignlive.co.uk/alist/2015/peter-souter/6fca2077-da99-4f25-bee4-cd807efff7c0</ref> <ref>https://www.campaignlive.co.uk/article/peter-souter-remain-chairman-tbwa-london/1440220</ref> <ref>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1_qe0usxvVE</ref> and former executive creative director of [[Abbott Mead Vickers BBDO]].<ref>https://www.independent.co.uk/news/media/cv-peter-souter--director-abbott-mead-vickers-bbdo-1142418.html</ref> <ref>https://www.independent.co.uk/news/media/cv-peter-souter-creative-director-abbott-mead-vickers-bbdo-1142418.html</ref> <ref>https://www.campaignlive.co.uk/article/amv-bbdo-advertising-supplement-profile-michael-baulk-andrew-robertson-peter-souter-new-power-generation-abbott-meads-seamless-succession-envy-adland/26558</ref> <ref>https://www.campaignlive.co.uk/article/peter-souter-exits-amv-career-tv-drama/828853</ref>
During his career as an advertising creative, Souter created a very large number of campaigns.
Peter Souter is also a writer, and has written plays for theatre and radio, including the screenplay for ITV's television drama ''[[Married Single Other]]''.<ref>https://www.imdb.com/name/nm2241480/</ref>
==Advertising career== Souter began his career in advertising as a copywriter at [[Abbott Mead Vickers BBDO]] in 1991, where he worked alongside Paul Brazier for 4 years. He then moved on to become deputy creative director in 1995, then executive creative director in 1997, taking over for [[David Abbott (advertising)|David Abbott]].<ref>http://www.moreaboutadvertising.com/2012/08/tbwa-uk-finally-admits-its-got-a-crisis-and-appoints-old-amv-hand-peter-souter-to-try-to-fix-it/</ref> In 2005 he worked on the 'Make Poverty History' campaign,<ref>http://www.coloribus.com/adsarchive/tv-commercials/make-poverty-history-make-poverty-history-7084355/</ref> which he said was the work of which he is most proud.<ref>https://www.telegraph.co.uk/lifestyle/interiors/10053402/My-space-Peter-Souter-advertising-executive-and-writer.html</ref>
==Writing career== Souter has written plays for radio, theatre and television. His radio plays for [[BBC Radio 4]] include ''[https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b008jgm1 Puddle]'', ''[https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b009mtcf Goldfish Girl]'', ''[https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b00j8dk1 Stream River Sea]'', ''[https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b010t7rs That's Mine, This is Yours]'', ''[https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b01ngmcl What Love Sounds like]'' and "[[https://vimeo.com/139834389 13a, 13b]]".
Souter's television drama, ''Married Single Other'', is a series based on the lives of group of people who are either married, single or "other", other being defined as in a relationship. It was aired on ITV in February 2010.<ref>https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1361110/</ref>
For theatre, Souter wrote the play ''Hello/Goodbye'', which was sold out at the Hampstead Theatre in its first run in 2013,<ref>https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/theatre/theatre-reviews/11370036/HelloGoodbye-Hampstead-Theatre-review-this-play-will-break-your-heart.html</ref> and is playing again from 21 January to 28 February 2015.<ref>http://www.hampsteadtheatre.com/whats-on/2015/hellogoodbye/</ref>

'''Reassignment centers''' are holding facilities for the [[New York City Department of Education]], where more than 600 teachers accused of [[misconduct]] have been paid to work full-time doing nothing for months or years at a time while awaiting resolution of their cases.<ref name="ap">{{cite news|publisher=Associated Press|title=NYC to stop paying teachers to do nothing|date=2010-04-15|author=Sara Kugler| url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/feedarticle/9032803}}</ref> Among teachers they are referred to as '''[[Padded cell|rubber rooms]]'''.<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/2007/10/10/education/10education.html | work=[[The New York Times]] | title=Where Teachers Sit, Awaiting Their Fates | first=Samuel G. | last=Freedman | date=October 10, 2007}}</ref> The city has 13 reassignment centers.<ref>[http://www.villagevoice.com/nyclife/0717,altman,76433,15.html village voice > nyclife > Class Dismissed by Mara Altman<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
In ''[[The Rubber Room]]'', it is also claimed that the city's teacher [[trade union|union]], the [[United Federation of Teachers]], neglects to provide proper representation to teachers assigned to reassignment centers.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.nypost.com/seven/03122007/news/regionalnews/rubber_room_teachers_demand_rights_regionalnews_david_andreatta____education_reporter.htm | work=New York Post | title='Rubber-Room' Teachers Demand Rights | first=DAVID ANDREATTA | last=Education | date=March 12, 2007}}</ref> Exonerated teachers often become [[Absent Teacher Reserve|absent teacher reserve]] teachers.
==Uses== The Department of Education blamed union rules that made it difficult to fire teachers. Some teachers assert that they have been sent to reassignment centers because they are [[whistleblowers]] against administrators for falsifying student test results or publicly challenging former [[New York City School Chancellor|Schools Chancellor]] [[Joel Klein]].<ref name="ap"/><ref>uft.org/news/teacher/top/axed/Whistle-blower axed — again</ref> Three Department of Education employees speaking to the UFT's "New York Teacher," confirmed teachers' allegations that [[Fordham High School for the Arts]] principal Iris Blige filed allegations against the school's UFT [[shop steward|chapter leader]], to place her in a reassignment center, in order to intimidate her and to set an example to the school's staff.<ref>Jim Callaghan, "Bronx principal alleged to have teacher 'hit list' still on job," "New York Teacher," April 23, 2009 {{dead link|date=September 2012}}</ref>
Reassignment centers arose as a budgetary concern in bureaucratic studies and press coverage in Spring 2008,<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.nydailynews.com/ny_local/education/2008/05/04/2008-05-04_teachers_in_trouble_spending_years_in_ru.html | location=New York | work=Daily News | title=Teachers in trouble spending years in 'rubber room' limbo that costs $65M | first=Erin | last=Einhorn | date=May 4, 2008}}</ref> and cost the city more than $65 million per year in labor expenses.<ref name="ap"/> In April, 2010, the city and teachers' union reached an agreement to end the practice.<ref name="ap"/> This agreement came in the midst of the first public presentation of a documentary on the centers.<ref name="origin.ny1.com">http://origin.ny1.com/9-staten-island-news-content/news_beats/education/116973/doe-to-end--rubber-room--practice/</ref>
Since the rubber room agreement, the only substantive change has been that there are no longer large rooms filled with reassigned teachers. Teachers are typically reassigned within their own schools, or to other Department of Education buildings throughout the city. Although teachers are now being charged more quickly, it still takes several years to complete the hearing process and for the arbitrator to render a decision. Many teachers are subsequently brought up on "3020-a" charges, which refer to the section of the New York State education law dealing with the discipline of tenured teachers. Unlike any other school district in New York State, no independent panel must vote to prefer charges against a tenured teacher in New York City. The 3020-a trial is held before an independent arbitrator, who is paid by the [[New York State Education Department]] but is selected jointly by the New York City Department of Education and the United Federation of Teachers.
In June 2012 it was revealed that the New York State Education Department had not paid its arbitrators for several years, and collectively owed them millions of dollars for cases they had completed, or were in the process of hearing. In frustration, ten of the 24 arbitrators on the New York City panel have quit, while the remaining 14 refuse to hear any testimony or issue any decisions until their back wages have been paid in full. This could take several more years to negotiate, further exacerbating the backlog of reassigned teachers.
==Documentary== Filmmakers Jeremy Garrett and Justin Cegnar of Five Boroughs Productions produced an [[independent film|independent]] documentary on the centers, called [[Rubber Room (film)|''The Rubber Room'']],<ref name="origin.ny1.com"/><ref>[http://www.rubberroommovie.com Rubber Room Movie]</ref><ref>[http://www.thislife.org/Radio_Episode.aspx?sched=1232 This American Life<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> which was the basis for a segment on the radio program ''[[This American Life]]''.<ref>http://thisamericanlife.org/Radio_Episode.aspx?episode=350</ref>
==In popular culture== {{unreferenced section|date=May 2017}}<!-- In addition, none of these entries provides any indication of their importanec meriting inclusion in the article --> * The final episode of NBC's ''[[Law & Order]]'', titled "[[Rubber Room (Law & Order)|Rubber Room]]", featured reassignment centers, which a disgraced former teacher, falsely accused of molesting a student, was assigned to (and which subsequently drove him mad and inspired his attempts to blow up his former school). * In the 2015 Showtime series [[The Affair (TV series)|''The Affair'']], Noah Solloway ([[Dominic West]]) is sent to a New York City Department of Education reassignment center as punishment for having sex with a teacher colleague on school premises. * In the 2015 Netflix series ''[[Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt]]'', Kimmy's GED class is being taught by an uninterested teacher who is purposely bad at his job in hopes of being sent to a reassignment center.

The '''Richard C. du Pont Memorial Trophy''' is an [[United States|American]] competitive award given annually by the [[Soaring Society of America]] to the U.S. National Open Class Soaring Champion, as determined at the annual U.S. National Open Class Soaring Championship.
First awarded in 1930 as the "Edward S. Evans Trophy," the current trophy was donated to the Soaring Society of America in 1947 by Mrs. [[Allaire du Pont]] in memory of her husband, [[Richard C. du Pont]], U.S. National Soaring Champion in 1934, 1935 and 1937 who died in the crash of an experimental [[military glider]] on September 11, 1943.

founder of Ivanhoe Capital Corporation | networth = {{gain}} US$1.8 [[1000000000 (number)|billion]] (March 2014)[https://www.forbes.com/profile/robert-friedland/ Forbes: "The World's Billionaires - Robert Friedland"] March 2014 | spouse = Darlene M. Friedland | children = 3 | parents = Ilona Muller Friedland
Albert Friedland | religion = | website = }} '''Robert Martin Friedland''' (August 18, 1950){{citation needed|date=March 2014}} is an American-Canadian international financier and major player in the junior mining industry. Since the early 1980s, he has specialized in securing funding for the exploration and development of mineral and energy resources and advanced technology ventures. He is the founder and Chairman of his private, family-owned firm, Ivanhoe Capital Corporation, which is active in global capital markets and has an established focus on emerging markets. Friedland is the founder of Ivanhoe Mines{{snd}}a Canadian public company listed on the New York, NASDAQ and Toronto exchanges. ==Early life and education== Robert Friedland was born in [[Chicago]], [[Illinois]], the eldest of three children born to immigrant parents Ilona (née Muller) and Albert Friedland.[https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2012-04-19/ivanhoe-ceo-loses-in-rio-chess-game-over-mongolia-mine.html Bloomberg News: "Ivanhoe CEO Loses in Rio ‘Chess Game’ Over Mongolia Mine" By Christopher Donville and Liezel Hill] April 19, 2012 Friedland's father survived three years in [[Auschwitz concentration camp|Auschwitz]] while his mother worked as a forced laborer during the [[Holocaust]].[http://minesmagazine.com/472/ Mines Magazine: "The Rough and Tough of Diamond Mining" By Lisa Marshall] January, 2011 He was expelled from [[Bowdoin College]] in 1970 after being arrested by federal authorities for the possession of an estimated $100,000 worth of [[LSD]], a crime for which he served two years in federal prison.{{cite web | url=http://orient.bowdoin.edu/orient/article.php?date=2012-03-02§ion=3&id=4 | title=Bowdoin's 'toxic' son | publisher=The Bowdoin Orient | date=March 2, 2012 | accessdate=March 23, 2012 | author=Cubeta, Charles}} He graduated in 1974 from [[Reed College]], Oregon, USA, with a [[political science]] degree.[http://www.reed.edu/reed_magazine/december2011/articles/features/jobs/jobs2.html Reed Magazine: "Prodigal Son"] December 2011 His senior year at Reed, Friedland was student body president. During his time at Reed he met [[Steve Jobs]] the co-founder of Apple, with whom he shared an interest in Eastern spirituality. At the time, Friedland served as the caretaker of an apple farm south of Portland that was owned by his millionaire uncle Marcel Muller[https://books.google.com/books?id=cf_2PBPP-rEC&pg=PT78&lpg=PT78&dq=Marcel+Muller+friedland&source=bl&ots=pNPpfM0x7l&sig=AAPA80vKZcygwFp2nvmEbX6mQ2M&hl=en&sa=X&ei=QXg3U8_3NsPjsATeyoHgCg&ved=0CDUQ6AEwAg#v=onepage&q=Marcel%20Muller%20friedland&f=false "Steve Jobs, Benjamin Franklin, Einstein by Walter Isaacson" By Walter Isaacson] October 24, 2011 and Jobs would come on the weekends and help with the apple orchard, which served as the inspiration for the name of his company, [[Apple Inc.]] Friedland turned the orchard into a [[History_of_the_hippie_movement#New_Communalism|commune]] called All One Farm. ==Career== Friedland operates Ivanhoe Capital from its corporate headquarters in Singapore{{snd}}a location that has facilitated his predominant business focus on the Asia Pacific region during the past 20 years. Friedland was Chief Executive Officer of Canada-based [[Ivanhoe Mines]] Ltd. (IVN: TSX, NYSE & NASDAQ), which he founded in 1994 and led to a successful initial public offering on the [[Toronto Stock Exchange]] in 1996.{{cite news|title=Friedland Factor Pulls in $310.5 million|newspaper=Financial Post, Toronto, Canada|date=14 June 1996}} He served as Chairman, and later as Executive Chairman, until 2011. Exploration by Ivanhoe Mines since 2000 has discovered a chain of copper, gold and silver deposits at Oyu Tolgoi (Turquoise Hill) in Mongolia’s [[South Gobi]] region. The first phase of what is independently projected to be one of the world’s largest porphyry copper and gold mines is under construction at [[Oyu Tolgoi]] and is expected to begin commercial production in 2013.{{cite web|title=Building Oyu Tolgoi: The Movie|url=http://www.ivanhoemines.com/i/Oyu_Video.html}}{{cite news|title=AMEC Minproc Technical Report, Oyu Tolgoi Project|url=http://www.ivanhoemines.com/i/pdf/IDP10_June062010.PDF|date=June 2010}} Ivanhoe Mines has discovered copper deposits in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC).{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/greatspeculations/2018/10/08/we-could-see-100-oil-again-soon-but-not-for-the-reason-you-think|title=We Could See $100 Oil Again Soon, But Not for the Reason You Think|last=Holmes|first=Frank|work=Forbes|access-date=2018-10-29|language=en}} Ivanhoe Mines also has substantial interests in SouthGobi Resources, Ivanhoe Australia and Altynalmas Gold.{{cite news|title=Ivanhoe Mines increases stake in Altynalmas Gold to 50%|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fuUAK_g9Dw0}} Friedland was chairman of Galactic Resources which operated [[Summitville mine]], the site of the United States' worst cyanide release and mine bankruptcy and [[Superfund]] site. This mine closed in 1990 but continues to affect the region. It is estimated that at least $120 million will be required to clean up the bankrupt Galactic Resources mining site, which has damaged 17 miles of river. The former environmental manager of the facility has been indicted for intentionally dumping lead and cyanide directly into streams.{{cite web | title =Summitville Mine | work =Region 8 - Superfund | publisher =U.S. Environmental Protection Agency | url =http://www.epa.gov/region8/sf/sites/co/sville.html | accessdate = 2007-01-04 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20061010032331/http://epa.gov/region8/sf/sites/co/sville.html |archivedate = 2006-10-10}} Copper mines operated by Ivanhoe in [[Myanmar]] have recently come under scrutiny as environmental degradation, illicit company practices, as well as inside dealings with the ruling military junta have created ethical concerns.{{cite web | title = Canada asked to probe driver’s disappearance. - Home Page | work = | publisher =Democratic Voice of Burma | url =http://www.dvb.no/news/canada-asked-to-probe-driver%E2%80%99s-disappearance/10771 | accessdate = 2010-07-20}} Friedland's other corporate leadership positions have included: :* Co-Founder, Executive Co-Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Ivanhoe Energy Inc. (IE: TSX & IVAN: NASDAQ). :* Chairman of Sunwing Holding Corporation. :* Executive Chairman of [[Ivanplats|Ivanplats Limited]]. :* Chairman and Non-Executive Director of Ivanhoe Australia Ltd. (IVA: ASX & TSX). :* Chairman, Potash One Inc.{{cite news|title=Potash One appoints Robert M. Friedland as Chairman, to assist in securing financing for new Canadian potash production project|url=http://www.kincommunications.com/clients/potashone/pressreleases/may122009/|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120425230852/http://www.kincommunications.com/clients/potashone/pressreleases/may122009/|archivedate=2012-04-25|df=}} :* Co-Chairman of Diamond Fields Resources Ltd.{{cite news|title=Diamond Fields Resources: Diamond Fields Resources accepts Inco acquisition proposal|url=http://www.infomine.com/press_releases/dfr/pr040396dfr.html|date=3 April 1996}} :* Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Galactic Resources Ltd.{{cite news|title=Summitville Fact File|url=http://www.ivanhoecapital.com}} ==Southgobi Resources controversy== By 2005, Friedland had staked a claim larger than Greece in Mongolia's Gobi Desert, an area containing copper and gold at the Oyu Tolgoy, or Turquoise Hill, site that he claimed could be worth more than $100 billion.{{cite news|title=Financier's saga of risk promises Gobi riches|url=http://www.minesandcommunities.org/article.php?a=168|date=October 2005}} In October 2012 Sarah Armstrong, chief legal counsel of Southgobi Resources, was temporarily detained in Mongolia and prevented from leaving the country for several months due to allegations that company management had bribed Mongolian state officials.{{cite news|title=SouthGobi Sands and Sarah Armstrong: Still No Official Statement from IAAC|url=http://ubpost.mongolnews.mn/?p=1631|date=October 2012}} The allegations resulted in the shutdown and search of SouthGobi headquarters in Mongolia by a Mongolian anti-corruption agency. Robert Friedland had been trying to sell his major (57.6%) stake in Southgobi Resources, which owned a major coal mining license in Mongolia, to Chalco, a Chinese state-owned corporation. Mongolian popular opposition to majority ownership by foreign state-owned enterprises of companies in their mining industry spurred action against the Southgobi deal and caused the suspension of the company's mining license for several months in 2012.{{cite news|title=Mongolia suspends SouthGobi licences|url=http://business.financialpost.com/2012/04/16/mongolia-suspends-southgobi-licences/|date=April 2012}} By May 2013 another chief financial officer at Southgobi Resources, Justin Capla who was previously questioned by Mongolian Anti Corruption Agency for bribing and money laundering actions case is being transferred to prosecution stage after 1 year of processing.{{cite news|title=SouthGobi Resources case is being transferred to prosecution|url=http://www.mongolnews.mn/i/42990|date=June 2013}} The Southgobi Resources ltd. is owned by Rio Tinto corporation.{{cite news|title=SouthGobi Resources widens Q4 loss on back of closed mine|url=http://www.miningweekly.com/article/southgobi-resources-widens-q4-loss-as-mine-remained-closed-2013-03-25|date=March 2013}}{{cite news|title=Mongolia: A Lucky but Difficult Pie to Slice|url=http://ubpost.mongolnews.mn/?p=1668|date=October 2012}}{{cite news|title=Fears for Aussie lawyer trapped in Mongolia|url=http://au.news.yahoo.com/thewest/a/-/breaking/15184236/fears-for-aussie-lawyer-trapped-in-mongolia/|date=October 2012}} ==Personal life== Robert Friedland holds dual US and Canadian citizenships and is also a resident of [[Singapore]].[http://jewishbusinessnews.com/2013/11/24/rober-friedlands-ivanhoe-mines-announces-strong-economic-assessment-for-copper-project-in-congo/ "Robert Friedland’s Ivanhoe Mines Announces Updated Economic Assessment for Copper Project in Congo"], [[Jewish Business News]], November 24, 2013 He and his wife Darlene are parents to three children. His son, Govind Friedland, is a geologist.[http://www.miningweekly.com/article/govind-friedland-following-in-fathers-footsteps-2011-02-18 Mining Weekly: "Govind Friedland following in father's footsteps" By Matthew Hill] February 18, 2011 ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==Further reading== *{{cite book|last=Francis|first=Diane|title=Who Owns Canada Now. Old Money, New Money and the Future of Canadian Business|year=2008|publisher=HarperCollins|isbn=978-0-00-200705-4}} *{{cite book|last=Newman|first=Peter C|title=The Canadian Establishment, Volume 3: The Titans{{snd}}How the New Canadian Establishment Seized Power|year=1998|publisher=Penguin|isbn=0-14-028700-0}} *{{cite book|last=McNish|first=Jacquie|title=The Big Score: Robert Friedland, Inco and the Voisey's Bay Hustle. Canada|year=1998|publisher=Doubleday|isbn=0-385-25758-9}} *{{cite book|last=Isaacson|first=Walter|title=Steve Jobs|year=2011|publisher=Simon & Schuster|location=New York|isbn=978-1-4516-4853-9|pages=630}} ==External links== *[http://orient.bowdoin.edu/orient/article.php?date=2012-03-02§ion=3&id=4 Bowdoin College] {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Friedland, Robert}} [[Category:Businesspeople in metals]] [[Category:1950 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Reed College alumni]] [[Category:Canadian businesspeople]] [[Category:Businesspeople from Chicago]] [[Category:American Jews]] [[Category:Canadian Jews]] [[Category:American billionaires]] [[Category:Canadian billionaires]] [[Category:Naturalized citizens of Canada]]

A '''schedule''', often called a '''rota''' or '''roster''', is a list of [[employment|employees]], and associated information e.g. location, working times, responsibilities for a given time period e.g. week, month or sports season.
A schedule is necessary for the day-to-day operation of many businesses e.g. [[retailing|retail store]], [[manufacturing]] facility and some [[offices]]. The process of creating a schedule is called '''scheduling'''. An effective workplace schedule balances the needs of stakeholders such as management, employees and [[customer]]s.
A ''daily'' schedule is usually ordered [[chronology|chronologically]], which means the first employees working that day are listed at the top, followed by the employee who comes in next, etc. A ''weekly'' or ''monthly'' schedule is usually ordered [[collation|alphabetically]], employees being listed on the left hand side of a grid, with the days of the week on the top of the grid.{{cn|date=October 2014}} In [[shift work]], a schedule usually employs a recurring [[shift plan]].
A schedule is most often created by a [[Management|manager]]. In larger operations, a [[human resources]] manager or scheduling specialist may be solely dedicated to creating and maintaining the schedule. A schedule by this definition is sometimes referred to as [[workflow]].{{cn|date=October 2014}}
Software is often used to enable organizations to better manage staff scheduling. Organizations commonly use [[spreadsheet]] software or [[employee scheduling software]] to create and manage shifts, assignments, and employee preferences. For large organisations employee scheduling can be complex,{{cn|date=October 2014}} and optimising this is framed as the [[Nurse scheduling problem]] in Operations Research.<ref>Math.edu [http://www.math.cmu.edu/~af1p/Teaching/OR2/Projects/P23/ORProject_Final_Copy.pdf "Nurse scheduling problem"]</ref> Advanced employee scheduling software also provides ways to connect with the staff, ask for their preferences and communicate the schedule to them.<ref name=NYT102812>{{cite news|title=A Part-Time Life, as Hours Shrink and Shift|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/10/28/business/a-part-time-life-as-hours-shrink-and-shift-for-american-workers.html|accessdate=October 28, 2012|newspaper=The New York Times|date=October 27, 2012|author=Steven Greenhouse}}</ref>
== On-call scheduling == An [[On call shift]] or On-call scheduling is a practice which requires employees to be available to be called onto last-minute shifts without pre-scheduling.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url = http://www.bizjournals.com/sanfrancisco/blog/2015/08/gap-ends-on-call-scheduling-gps-worker-bill-rights.html|title = Gap decides not to keep its store workers waiting|last = Sciacca|first = Annie|date = August 27, 2015|work = [[San Franc. Bus. Times|San Francisco Business Times]]|access-date = August 28, 2015}}</ref> In the United States, the practice has been opposed by [[labor rights]] groups as "unfair and detrimental to employees."<ref name=":0" />

{{notability|1=Biographies|date=March 2018}} {{refimprove|date=March 2018}} '''Sir Thomas Dunlop, 3rd Baronet''', [[OStJ]] (11 April 1912 – 18 August 1999) was a [[Scotland|Scottish]] businessman.{{cite web |url=http://www.heraldscotland.com/news/12265838.Sir_Thomas_Dunlop/ |title=Sir Thomas Dunlop |newspaper=[[The Herald (Glasgow)]] |date=28 August 1999 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}{{Who's Who |surname=Dunlop |othernames=Sir Thomas |id=U178148 |type=was |volume= |edition=2018 online |accessdate=26 March 2018}} ==Life== Dunlop was educated at [[Kelvinside Academy]], [[Craigflower Preparatory School]], [[Shrewsbury School]] and [[St John's College, Cambridge]]. He qualified as a chartered accountant with McClelland Ker & Co and in 1938 became a partner in the family business, Thomas Dunlop & Sons, Shipowners and Insurance Brokers, founded in 1851. He was the fourth generation. During the [[World War II|Second World War]] he served as a major with the [[Royal Signals]] in India and the United Kingdom. He returned to the family business and a succession of appointments in Glasgow. During the 1950s he served as a director of Glasgow & Clyde Shipowners' Association, vice president of the Royal Alfred Seafarers' Society, honorary agent of [[The Shipwrecked Fishermen and Mariners' Royal Benevolent Society]] and chairman of the Underwriters' Association of Glasgow. In 1955, he became Deacon of the Incorporation of Bakers of Glasgow and a director of the Merchant's House. In the 1960s he served as chairman of the [[Trustee Savings Bank]] of Glasgow. Dunlop retired from the family business in 1986. In March 1965 he was appointed as an [[Order of Saint John (chartered 1888)|Officer of the Order of St John]].{{London Gazette |issue=43613 |pages=3196–3197 |date=30 March 1965}} He succeeded as the third Baronet on the death of his father in 1963. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{S-start}} {{S-reg|uk-bt}} {{Succession box | title=[[Dunlop baronets|Baronet]]

'''Stephen Bradley Saad''' (born June 1964) is a South African [[billionaire]] businessman, who is the founder and chief executive of [[Aspen Pharmacare]] ({{JSE|APN}}), the largest producer of generic medicines in Africa.
==Early life== Stephen Bradley Saad was born in June 1964,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/officers/E-asRzxkSRGMtPnLIVewsBVSOR0/appointments |title=Stephen Bradley SAAD - Personal Appointments (free information from Companies House) |publisher=Beta.companieshouse.gov.uk |date= |accessdate=23 June 2017}}</ref> and raised in [[Durban]], South Africa.<ref name="andrewengland">Andrew England, [http://www.ft.com/intl/cms/s/0/3b36fa8a-4d27-11e3-bf32-00144feabdc0.html#axzz2zfSiD34C South Africa’s dose of big pharma], ''[[Financial Times]]'', 17 November 2013</ref> He attended the [[Durban High School]] in Durban.<ref name="calebmelby">Caleb Melby, [https://www.forbes.com/sites/calebmelby/2012/12/17/south-african-pharma-entrepreneur-stephen-saad-joins-the-billionaires-club/ South African Pharma Entrepreneur Stephen Saad Joins The Billionaires' Club], ''[[Forbes]]'', 17 December 2012</ref><ref name="dhsfoundation">{{Cite web|url=http://www.dhsfoundation.co.za/about-us/dhs-foundation-board-of-trustees/26-about-us/the-trustees/89-stephen-saad|title=DHS Foundation {{!}} DHS school community of Old Boys|last=Foundation|first=DHS|website=www.dhsfoundation.co.za|language=en|access-date=2017-09-12}}</ref> He graduated from the [[University of Natal]], where he received a Bachelor of Commerce.<ref name="calebmelby"/><ref name="dhsfoundation"/><ref name="bloomberg">{{Cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/markets/stocks|title=Stocks|website=Bloomberg.com|access-date=2018-01-09}}</ref> He played rugby in [[Ireland]] and studied to become a chartered accountant.<ref name="andrewengland"/><ref name="dhsfoundation"/><ref name="bloomberg"/>
==Career== He started his career at Quickmed, a prescription drug distribution company in black townships during [[apartheid]].<ref name="andrewengland"/> At the age of twenty-nine, he sold his share in Covan Zurich for US$3 million, thus becoming a millionaire.<ref name="forbes">{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/stephen-saad/|title=Stephen Saad|work=Forbes|access-date=2017-09-12|language=en}}</ref>
In 1997, together with [[Gus Attridge]], he co-founded [[Aspen Pharmacare]], a public company traded on the [[Johannesburg Stock Exchange]].<ref name="dhsfoundation"/><ref name="financialmail">Andile Makholwa, [http://www.financialmail.co.za/moneyinvesting/2013/12/19/stephen-saad-aspen-s-money-spinner Stephen Saad: Aspen's money spinner], ''[[Financial Mail]]'', 19 December 2013</ref> It has become the largest producer of generic medicines on the African continent.<ref name="forbes"/> He serves as its chief executive and Gus Attridge as its deputy chief executive, and serves on its board of directors.<ref name="bloomberg"/><ref name="financialmail"/><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.aspenpharma.com/bod-new.aspx|title=Aspen Pharmacare|website=www.aspenpharma.com|language=en-ZA|access-date=2018-01-09|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140423202859/http://www.aspenpharma.com/bod-new.aspx|archivedate=23 April 2014|df=dmy-all}}</ref> In 2011, he was worth US$640 million, becoming one of Africa's 40 richest people.<ref name="calebmelby"/> His stock portfolio went up 75% in 2013.<ref name="forbes"/> He is now worth US$1.4 billion.<ref name="andrewengland"/><ref name="calebmelby"/><ref name="forbes"/><ref name="janemarais">Jane Marais, [http://www.timeslive.co.za/business/2010/12/04/the-billionaires-are-back The Billionaires are back], ''[[The Times (South Africa)|The Times]]'', 4 December 2010</ref>
Additionally, he chairs the [[Sharks (rugby union)|Sharks]], a rugby union club in Durban.<ref name="andrewengland"/> He also sits on the board of trustees of his alma mater, the Durban High School.<ref name="dhsfoundation"/> In 2014, he was awarded an honorary doctorate from [[Nelson Mandela Metropolitan University]] for the positive role of Aspen in the city of Port Elizabeth <ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.nmmu.ac.za/Life@NMMU/April-2014/Honorary-doctorates-all-humble-recipients}}{{Dead link|date=June 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=no }}</ref>
==Personal life== He resides in Durban and spends time at his private reserve in the [[Sabi Sand Game Reserve]] near the [[Kruger National Park]].<ref name="forbes"/> He is married with four daughters.<ref name="dhsfoundation"/><ref name="forbes"/>

[[Peter Alfond]] (brother) | website = }} '''Ted Alfond''' (born 1945) is an American investor, philanthropist, and billionaire. ==Biography== Ted Alfond was born to a [[American Jews|Jewish]] family, the son of Dorothy (nee Levine) and [[Harold Alfond]].[https://www.nytimes.com/2007/11/17/business/17alfond.html New York Times; "Harold Alfond, Donor and Shoe Factory Owner, Dies at 93" By RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA] November 17, 2007[http://mainejews.org/TEXT/Colby/BibbyLevineAlfondScrapbook.pdf Colby College Digital Commons: "Bibby Levine Alfond Scrapbook"] January 1, 2011Silbiger, Steve [https://books.google.com/books?id=2CAGE9yJcm8C&pg=silverman#v=onepage&q=werner&f=false The Jewish Phenomenon: Seven Keys to the Enduring Wealth of a People] p. 89 His father founded the Dexter Shoe Company in 1958 and sold it in 1995 for $433 million of [[Berkshire Hathaway]] stock. When his father died in 2007, he left his shares in Berkshire Hathaway to his four children, Ted, Susan, Bill, and Peter, who are now all billionaires. In 1968, he graduated from [[Rollins College]] and after school, he worked as Executive Vice President of Dexter Shoe Company. He is a part owner of the [[Boston Red Sox]][http://lib.rollins.edu/olin/oldsite/archives/golden/alfond.htm Rollins College: "Harold Alfond (1914-2007) - Business Leader and Strong Supporter of the Rollins Sports Program] ==Personal life== Alfond is married to Barbara Lawrence[http://agb.org/trusteeship/2014/9/going-all-alfond-inn-how-one-board-helped-bring-big-idea-fruition AGB Trusteeship Magazine: "Going all in for the Alfond Inn: How One Board Helped Bring a Big Idea to Fruition" By Julie Bourbon] September/October 2014 whom he met in college; they have three children: John Alfond,[https://www.nytimes.com/1998/04/05/style/weddings-jill-landman-and-john-alfond.html New York Times: "WEDDINGS; Jill Landman And John Alfond"] April 5, 1998 Jenny Alfond Seeman,[https://www.nytimes.com/1997/06/15/style/jennifer-alfond-thomas-seeman.html New York Times: "Jennifer Alfond, Thomas Seeman"] June 15, 1997 and Katharine Alfond Donahue.[https://www.nytimes.com/1997/09/28/style/weddings-katharine-alfond-joseph-donahue.html New York Times: "WEDDINGS; Katharine Alfond, Joseph Donahue"] September 28, 1997 ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Alfond, Ted}} [[Category:American billionaires]] [[Category:Jewish American philanthropists]] [[Category:Philanthropists]] [[Category:1945 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Rollins College alumni]] [[Category:Businesspeople from Maine]] [[Category:Boston Red Sox executives]] [[Category:Alfond family|Ted]] {{philanthropist-stub}}

'''Transformational Government''' is the use of computer-based information and communications technologies (ICT) to change the way governments work. The term is commonly used to describe a government reform strategy which attempts to radically change the way people understand government, especially those working within government. For example, it is often associated with a 'whole-of-government' viewpoint, which tries to foster cross-department collaboration and provide 'one-stop-shop' convenience in the delivery of services to citizens.
The term ''Transformational Government'' is usually used aspirationally, as denoting the 'highest' level of what [[e-government]] can achieve: # presence, where ICT, and usually websites, are used to provide information; # interaction, where government interacts with citizens, and departments interact with each other, online especially by email; # transaction, where such things as paying taxes or licenses are carried out online; # transformation, which involves a reinvention of government functions and how they operate.<ref name=Gartner>{{cite web|publisher=Gartner Group|title= Gartner's Four Phases of E-Government Model. Research Note Tutorials|year= 2000|url=http://www.gartner.com}}</ref> In relation to developing countries, it is often associated with hopes of reducing corruption, and in relation to developed countries, with attempts to increase the involvement of the private and voluntary sectors in government activity.
==History== During the last two decades, governments around the world have invested in ICT with the aim of increasing the quality and decreasing the cost of public services. But over that time, as even the least developed countries have moved to websites, e-services and e-Government strategies, it has become increasingly clear that e-Government has not delivered all the benefits that were hoped for it.<ref>‘The failure of e-government in developing countries: a literature review’. The Electronic Journal on Information System in Developing Countries. Dada, D. (2006)</ref> One study found that 35% of e-government projects in developing countries resulted in total failures; and that 50% were partial failures.<ref>{{cite web|title=eGovernment as a Carrier of Context - IGovernment Working Paper No.15, Institute for Development Policy and Management, University of Manchester, Manchester, U.K. Higher Education Admission Center (HEAC) Heeks, R. (2004)|url=http://www.heac.gov.om/heac_en/index.asp}}</ref>
In reaction to these poor outcomes, there has been a shift of perspective to 'Transformational Government', aiming beyond purely technical aspects of better enabling e-government processes towards addressing the cultural and organisational barriers which have hindered public service benefits realisation. Researchers have defined the rationale for Transformational Government as “the exploitation of e-government such that benefits can be realized”.<ref>Electronic transformation of government in the UK: A research agenda. European Journal of Information Systems 16, 327-335 Irani, Z., Elliman, T. and Jackson, P. (2007)</ref>
In 2010 the [[OASIS (organization)|Organization for the Advancement of Structured Information Standards]] (OASIS) published a report<ref name="oasis-egov.org">{{cite web|url=http://www.oasis-egov.org/library|title=Library of all approved outputs from the eGov Member Section - OASIS eGov|publisher=}}</ref> which identified a wide range of common pitfalls which have hampered many governments in achieving significant impacts through their technology investments. However, OASIS also noted that: :“… an increasing number [of governments] are now getting to grips with the much broader and complex set of cultural and organizational changes which are needed for ICT to deliver significant benefits to the public sector. This new approach is generally referred to as Transformational Government.”
OASIS cites <ref name="oasis-egov.org"/> the UK and Australia as two of the leaders in this area: : “Transformational Government…. encompasses a new "virtual" business layer within government which allows an integrated, government-wide, citizen-focused service to be presented to citizens across all channels, but at no extra cost and without having to restructure government to do so. Two very good examples of this new approach are South Australia’s “Ask Just Once” portal and the UK Government’s DirectGov portal, and the approach is explained in very good detail in the CS Transform’s white paper entitled "Citizen Service Transformation – a manifesto for change in the delivery of public services”.
== Countries with Transformational Government Initiatives == Within the last decade, this new emphasis on a Transformational Government approach can be seen from a number of countries:
{| class="wikitable" |- ! Country ! Initiative(s) ! Details |- | Canada | Government On-Line (GOL) | Report of the Auditor General of Canada: Chapter 1 Information Technology: Government On-Line 2003 <ref>[http://www.cbc.ca/news/background/auditorgeneral/ag_report2004/20031101ce.pdf Canada - Report of the Auditor General of Canada, 2003 ]</ref> :“One of the key principles of Government On-Line is that programs and services will be transformed to reflect the needs and expectations of clients and citizens. From the government’s perspective, the overall objective of the GOL initiative is full service transformation – to fundamentally change the way the government operates and to deliver better services to Canadians.” |- | UK | gov.uk | Transformational Government: Enabled by Technology, 2005 <ref>[http://www.cabinetoffice.gov.uk/media/141734/transgov-strategy.pdf UK - Transformational Government: Enabled by Technology 2005 ] {{Webarchive|url=http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/20090504050901/http%3A//www.cabinetoffice.gov.uk/media/141734/transgov%2Dstrategy.pdf |date=2009-05-04 }}</ref> :“The future of public services has to use technology to give citizens choice, with personalised services designed around their needs not the needs of the provider” |- | USA | PIF, 18F, USDS | Presidential Innovation Fellows program where "teams of government experts and private-sector doers take a user-centric approach to issues at the intersection of people, processes, products, and policy to achieve lasting impact"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.whitehouse.gov/innovationfellows|title=Presidential Innovation Fellows|date=23 June 2015|publisher=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140419040539/http://www.whitehouse.gov/innovationfellows|archivedate=19 April 2014|df=}}</ref> launched in 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2012/08/23/white-house-launches-presidential-innovation-fellows-program|title=White House Launches Presidential Innovation Fellows Program|date=23 August 2012|publisher=}}</ref> [[18F]] a new digital government delivery service, was formed in early 2014<ref>{{cite web|url=http://18fblog.tumblr.com/post/80066867648/hello-world-we-are-18f|title=Hello, world! We are 18F.|publisher=}}</ref> and United States Digital Service (USDS) was launched later in 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/the-switch/wp/2014/08/11/white-house-launches-u-s-digital-service-with-healthcare-gov-fixer-at-the-helm/|title=White House launches ‘U.S. Digital Service,’ with HealthCare.gov fixer at the helm|publisher=}}</ref> |- | Korea | Government 3.0 | Announced in 2013 with "an ambitious plan to allow wider public access to government data to improve the transparency of state affairs.",<ref>{{cite web|url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=2973371|title=Park unveils ‘Government 3.0’|publisher=}}</ref> this initiative includes: citizen-centered government innovation, core values of openness, sharing, communication, collaboration for all areas of governing, customized services to individual citizens, which will create jobs and support creative economy<ref>http://www.gov30.go.kr/gov30/cmm/fms/FileDown.do;jsessionid=7164645AF1082FB9879B21090874219A.node02?atchFileId=FILE_000000000005151&fileSn=0</ref> |}
==International initiatives== The early pioneering work by some governments is now being picked up and championed by a range of global organizations which offer support to governments in moving to a Transformational Government approach. For example: *The [[World Bank]] has set up an eTransform Initiative (ETI) with support from global IT partners such as Gemalto, IBM, L-1 Identity Solutions, Microsoft and Pfizer. "The eTransform Initiative is about tapping information technology, expertise and experiences”, said Mohsen Khalil, Director of the World Bank Group’s Global Information and Communication Technologies Department. “Government transformation is about change management facilitated by technology. This initiative will facilitate the exchange of lessons and experiences among various governments and industry players, to maximize impact and lower risks of ICT-enabled government transformation.” *A number of private sector organizations working in this area have published white papers which pull together global best practices on Government Transformation.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.microsoft.com/industry/publicsector/government/csp/solutions_directory.aspx|title=Microsoft in Government: technology solutions for government agencies|publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cstransform.com/|title=Citizen Service Transformation|publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cstransform.com/|title=Citizen Service Transformation|publisher=}}</ref><ref>[http://www.accenture.com/Global/Research_and_Insights/Institute_For_Public_Service_Value/Research/Front-Office-Shared-Services.htm Sharing Front Office Services: The Journey to Citizen-Centric Delivery, Accenture 2009]</ref> *OASIS launched (September 2010) a new Technical Committee tasked with producing a new global best practice standard for a Transformational Government Framework. The Framework is expressed as a number of "Pattern Languages", each providing a detailed set of guidance notes and conformance clauses on how to deliver the required changes in practice.

She is the David S. Van Pelt Family Distinguished Professor of Marketing at [[Kenan-Flagler Business School]], [[University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill]]. Zeithml is an expert in the area of [[services marketing]] and [[service quality]]. In the 1980s Zeithaml and her co-authors developed [[SERVQUAL]], a quality management framework for services. '''Vladìmir Anísimoff''' (born 14 March 1950<ref>{{cite web|title=ВЛАДИМИР АНИСИМОВ (РОД. 1950)|url=http://classic-online.ru/ru/composer/Anisimoff/17907}}</ref> in [[Leningrad]], [[USSR]]) is a Russian composer, scientist-[[physicist]], philosopher-agnostic, writer, and philanthropist. He is [[grandnephew]] of revolutionary-[[Mensheviks|menshevik]] [[Vasily Anisimoff]] and [[grandnephew]] of the famous Soviet pedagogue [[:ru:Афанасьев, Пётр Онисимович|Pyotr Afanasiev]], who created the most popular in the young Soviet Russia ABC book in Russian language "Read, write, count" (24 editions) and the Russian language Textbook for primary school. Vladimir Anísimoff is famous as a scientist in the field of magnetic resonance.<ref>Владимир Викторович Анисимов "Исследование взаимодействий ядерных спинов с решеткой в некубических кристаллах методами магнитного и акустического резонансов" Автореферат на соискание ученой степени кандидата физико-математических наук. 1979. [[National Library of Russia|Российская Национальная Библиотека]], [[St. Petersburg|Санкт-Петербург]]</ref> He developed method for the study of hidden internal surfaces,<ref name="multiple">Владимир Викторович Анисимов "ЯМР как метод исследования энергетической неоднородности скрытых поверхностей" Автореферат на соискание ученой степени доктора физико-математических наук. 1989. [[Semenov Institute of Chemical Physics|ИХФ АН СССР]], [[Moscow|Москва]]</ref> also he worked in the field of [[magnetic resonance imaging]],in particular, in the study of membranes.<ref>В.В.Анисимов, В.Ф.Сафронов, Л.А.Колонтаевская "Линии ЯМР 1Н воды в микроэмульсиях", '''Доклады Академии Наук СССР''', том 266, № 2, стр. 374, 1982. УДК 541.183:541.182: Физическая химия, Представлено академиком [[Nikolay Emanuel|Н.М.Эмануэлем]] 22 II 1982</ref> Also he known as the author of rare duration and depth of the content of the Symphony "FrognerPark".<ref>{{cite web|title=Владимир Анисимов Симфония N 2 "Фрогнер-Парк"|url=http://arustra.narod.ru/music.html}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Vladimir Anisimoff Symphony no.2 "FROGNERPARK"|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w7jjntDze4M}}</ref> This Symphony is similar to sculptural FrognerPark of [[Gustav Vigeland]] in Oslo and reflects a full range of feelings and emotions of a person during his life. "Unicum Organum" is his fundamental philosophical work in the understanding of human life as a continuous process of information processing by chemical processors of brain.
== Biography ==
=== Early years === Vladimir Anisimoff was born on 14 March 1950 in [[Leningrad]], [[USSR]] in the family of construction engineer Victor Anisimoff, the nephew of the famous Russian revolutionary [[Vasily Anisimoff]]. He received an excellent private and public education in the Soviet period in Russia. : Vladimir Anisimoff since childhood fond of music, and especially music composition, but on the advice of his parents, he first received higher education in engineering. : Simultaneously, he studied choral conducting at the [[:ru:Музыкальная школа имени Н. А. Римского-Корсакова|Rimsky-Korsakov Music College for adults]] in [[Saint-Petersburg]].
=== Scientific activity === Vladimir Anisimoff started his research in the field of magnetic resonance in the early 1970s under the leadership of Professors Alexander Belonogov and Dmitry Dianov in [[Saint Petersburg State Electrotechnical University]]. In 1980 he received the degree of philosophy doctor ([[Saint Petersburg State Electrotechnical University]] and [[Saint Petersburg State University]], opponent was professor of [[Saint Petersburg State University]] Vladimir Shutilov) and continued his studies in cooperation with academician [[Nikolay Emanuel]]. After the sudden death [[Nikolay Emanuel|Emanuel]] in 1984 Vladimir Anisimoff continued his research under the guidance of academician [[:ru:Бучаченко, Анатолий Леонидович|Anatoly Buchachenko]]. In 1989 [[:ru:Бучаченко, Анатолий Леонидович|Anatoly Buchachenko]] presented Vladimir Anisimoff to the protection of the second (as it is accepted in Russia) doctoral thesis.<ref name="multiple" /> : For 20 years Vladimir Anisimoff has published about 50 scientific works. [[File:Vladimir Anisimoff composer & physicist 2009.jpg|thumb|left|Vladimir Anisimoff is composer & physicist]]

Emanuel]] "Lines of magnetic resonance of protons of water in micro emulsions", Reports of Academy of Sciences. Moscow, 266, N 2(1982), p. 374 * V.V. Anisimoff, "Magnetic resonance methods in research of processes on surfaces" (great overview of the present status of these studies), Surface. Moscow, N 9 (1984), p. 5
=== Business and philanthropy === During [[perestroika]] (1986–2000), Vladimir Anisimoff had to get a new education – broker on the currency exchange. In 1993 Vladimir Anisimoff organized a joint stock company "New Company of Investors" '''NCI corp.'''.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://infored.ru/company/583594 | title = Joint stock company '''NCI corp.'''(ОАО '''НКИ''')}}</ref> It served production garages for population, and a full range of printing services. : At the same time, as the President of the '''NCI corp.''', Vladimir Anisimoff organized together with his friend the composer Alexander Sledin<ref>[http://bogemnyipeterburg.net/vocabulare/alfavit/persons/s/sledinaleksandr.htm Magazine "Bohemian Petersburg", "Alexander Sledin"]</ref> regular concerts on Ostrovsky square in [[St. Petersburg]] in Hall of [[:ru:Санкт-Петербургская государственная Театральная библиотека|St. Petersburg state theatre library]], which played music of modern composers of [[St. Petersburg|Petersburg]]. The concerts were carried out regularly over four seasons from 1993 to 1997.<ref>{{cite web | url =http://sptl.spb.ru/?lang=en | title = Saint-Petersburg state theatre library}}</ref> : Since 2005 Vladimir Anisimoff financially assisted the organization of many concerts of famous [[St. Petersburg]] teams and in Russia, and abroad. In particular, some time he supported the [[:ru:Роговой оркестр|Horn Orchestra of Russia]].<ref>{{cite web | url =http://www.horns.ru | title = Horn Orchestra of Russia}}</ref> : In the period from 2001 to 2003 the '''NCI corp.''' has undergone [[Corporate raid|capture raid]] on the part of power structures of [[St. Petersburg]]. According opinion of composer Alexander Sledin<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.spb-composers.ru/composers/126-sledin-/394-sledinbio | title = Alexander Sledin}}</ref> "It came under the control of people who had no connection either philanthropy or to the understanding of human relations between people". : From 2010 Vladimir Anisimoff retired and became the only composer and writer. : In 2009 Vladimir Anisimoff together with his son Dmitry Anisimov founded a new type of Philharmonic – the [[Virtual International Philharmonic]].
=== Music === Vladimir Anisimoff really began to study composition at the [[Seminar of Amateur composers]] in class of [[Johann Admoni]] in 1971, and completed his study with professor [[Joseph Pustylnik]] in 1980.
==== main musical works ==== * Symphony no.1 "Analysis and Synthesis" op.14, 1975, final edition – 2011 * Symphony no.2 "FROGNERPARK" op.without number, 1991 * Symphony no.3 "SINFONIA PICCOLA" op.33, 2004<ref>{{citation | url = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0mXAU9f-Mxc | title = Vladimir Anisimoff SINFONIA PICCOLA, premiere in "Kareliasali", Imatra, Suomi-Finland, 2009}}</ref> * Chamber music, in particular, – "Traffic sing", poems by [[Konstantin Vanshenkin]] (op.2,1972), "Andante cantabile" for violin & piano(op.12, 1975), "Sonata for the piano" (op.6,1973), "Chaconne" for string quartet (op.11, 1974), "Space ways" for oboe, fagotto & computer (2005) and many others. * Musical "Only, Only Ready Cash" (in Russian "Чистоган")(op. 29, 2003–2010, the musical was written about the period of [[perestroika]], it was censored and excluded from the plan of the theater's performances)

=== Philosophy === After Vladimir Anisimoff has become known in their field scholar, in 2005 he decided to summarize their knowledge in philosophical work "UNICUM ORGANUM"<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.anisimovdmitry.com/Documents/Father/UnicumOrganum_VladimirAnisimoff.pdf|title = Владимир Анисимов "UNICUM ORGANUM"}}</ref> : He has consistently promoted the ideas of [[Immanuel Kant]] about the unknowable essence of the matter.
=== Fiction === Recently since 2004 Vladimir Anisimoff was fond of writing funny stories. He finds himself in these simple stories about everything he sees around him.

=== Personal life === Vladimir Anisimoff married (1975) on the cousin of the famous Soviet actress [[Marina Neyolova]] Nina Ivanova (Neyolova at her mother). He has two adult children. Son Dmitry Anisimov<ref>{{citation | url =http://www.anisimovdmitry.com/ | title = phd student Dmitry Anisimov}}</ref> work mathematician in [[University of Lugano|USI]] in the group of well-known scientist Kai Hormann<ref>{{citation | url =http://www.inf.usi.ch/hormann/ | title = Profile of Professor Kai Hormann}}</ref> and live in [[Lugano]], Switzerland.

'''Dr. Zvi Gabbay''' is a partner and the Head of the Capital Markets and Financial Regulation Department at the [[Barnea & Co.|Barnea & Co]]. law firm. Prior to this, Dr. Gabbay served as the Head of Enforcement and a member of management at the [[Israel Securities Authority]] (ISA).
== Education == Upon completing his military service as an officer and combatant in the [[Nahal Brigade|Nahal Infantry Brigade]] of the [[Israel Defense Forces]], Gabbay studied law at the [[Hebrew University of Jerusalem]], earning his LL.B. He went on to receive his [[Master of Laws]] degree (LL.M) [[Magna cum Laude|magna cum laude]] from [[Bar-Ilan University]]. Gabbay continued his studies in [[New York City|New York]] at [[Columbia University]], where he earned a second Master of Laws degree summa cum laude in 2004.<ref name=":0" />
During his studies, Gabbay worked as a teaching assistant, as well as took part in the mediation clinic at Columbia University. After receiving his second LL.M., Gabbay continued his academic studies at Columbia University, earning a [[Doctor of Juridical Science]] (J.S.D.) in 2006.<ref name=":0" /> His research focused on alternatives to the criminal justice system, based on analyses of administrative law, disciplinary hearings, and restorative justice.<ref>{{Cite book|title=Restorative Works|last=|first=|publisher=International Institute for Restorative Practices|year=2013|isbn=|location=Canada|pages=13, 55}}</ref>
== Public Activities == Gabbay served as a member of the committee assembled by former Minister of Justice [[Yaakov Neeman]], and headed by then [[Deputy Attorney General|Deputy Attorney-General]] (criminal matters) Raz Nazari, which re-examined the issue of corporate criminal liability. The committee published a memorandum for the draft bill Criminal Liability for Corporations Law (2014).
Gabbay is currently a member of the board of governors of the [[International Institute for Restorative Practices]] (IIRP) Europe<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=https://www.iirp.edu/who-we-are/trustees/60-zvi-gabbay-esq-j-s-d|title=Zvi Gabbay, Esq., J.S.D.|last=Staff|first=IIRP|website=www.iirp.edu|language=en-GB|access-date=2017-09-06}}</ref>.
Gabbay is also a member of the board of governors of Amutat Kedem, an Israeli [[Nonprofit organization|NPO]] that engages in conciliatory processes using family group conferences and restorative justice to help children at-risk youth, and youth offenders.
During his residence in the [[United States]], Gabbay engaged in [[volunteer work]], mediating more than 50 cases in the various courts in New York. He also served as a moderator and mediator in the Community Impact Panel program, which convened at the [[Midtown Community Court]] in [[Manhattan]]. Gabbay volunteers as a mediator in business disputes in Israeli courts.
== Career == Gabbay began his legal career as a [[prosecutor]] in the [[Tel Aviv]] District Attorney’s Office (Criminal Department). There he managed all stages of criminal cases, from investigations, trials, and rulings through to appeals. Upon completing his studies in New York, Gabbay joined the international law firm [[Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom]] LLP. During his tenure at the firm, Gabbay focused on representing private and business clients undergoing internal investigations, working in collaboration with the firm’s civil litigation department. He also engaged in pro bono representation of clients in civil and criminal courts.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.legal500.com/firms/13399-barnea-co/offices/14050-tel-aviv-israel/lawyers/9017194|title=The Legal 500 > Barnea & Co > Tel Aviv, ISRAEL > Lawyer profiles > Adv Dr Zvi Gabbay|website=www.legal500.com|language=en-us|access-date=2017-09-06}}</ref>
Gabbay returned to Israel in 2008 and was appointed the Head of Enforcement and a member of management at the Israel Securities Authority (ISA). As Head of Enforcement, Gabbay handled the interfaces between the regulatory arm of the ISA and the enforcement powers it wields<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.globes.co.il/en/article-teva-minor-player-in-alleged-us-price-fixing-1001168668|title=Teva minor player in alleged US price fixing - Globes English|last=|first=|date=|website=Globes|language=he|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-09-06|quote=Dr. Zvi Gabbay, formerly responsible for enforcement in the Israel Securities Authority}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.kahollavan.co.il/ACCI/AccJan10/moreInfo.html|title=ACCI|website=www.kahollavan.co.il|access-date=2017-09-06}}</ref>. In this context, he engaged in legislative initiatives and in forging new regulations. Gabbay was also part of the lean team that drove the enactment of the Administrative Enforcement Law.
In 2011, Gabbay left the ISA and became a partner at the Gornitzky and Co. law firm<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.gornitzky.com/inappropriately-expand-israel-securities-authoritys-authority|title=Inappropriately expand Israel Securities Authority's authority|website=www.gornitzky.com|access-date=2017-09-06}}</ref>. Two years later, in 2013, he resigned and founded a boutique capital markets law firm: Adini, Berger, Gabbay.
In 2016, Gabbay joined Barnea & Co. as a partner and department head. Gabbay provides assistance and legal counsel to public companies and investment houses in Israel on issues involving the capital market and corporate governance. Gabbay also represents clients before various enforcement bodies in relation to investigations and administrative inquiries<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.barlaw.co.il/attorneys/3827/|title=Zvi Gabbay, Capital Markets {{!}} Barnea & Co.|work=Barnea & Co.|access-date=2017-09-06|language=en-US}}</ref>.
=== Academic lectures ===
Gabbay was a guest lecturer at the [[College of Law and Business]], where he taught a [[seminar]] on white collar crime. He has also lectured at both the School of Law at the College of Management and the School of Law at Columbia University on mediation and negotiations.
